thread.title: Prep Roundup; Lassiter to face Walton for area title
thread.title_full: Prep Roundup; Lassiter to face Walton for area title

author: MDJ staff reports (noreply@mdjonline.com)
title: Prep Roundup; Lassiter to face Walton for area title
text: Prep Roundup; Lassiter to face Walton for area title by MDJ staff reports The Marietta Daily Journal October 08, 2015 12:20 AM | 560 views | 0 | 3 | | After losing to Walton 25-23, 25-14 in the winners’ bracket final of the Area 5 championship at Pope, Lassiter rebounded to beat Pope 25-14, 25-22 in the losers’ bracket final and will rematch with Walton for the area championship today at the Hound Pound.Libby Bochniak had a total of 11 kills and 10 digs for the Lady Trojans (28-7). Ella Muetterties had eight kills, while Micah Ensor totaled eight kills and seven digs. Kate Gordon dished out 31 assists.SOFTBALL► Pope 7, Etowah 6: Pope secured its sixth consecutive state playoff berth with a walk-off win in a losers’ bracket game of the Region 5 tournament at Cherokee.The Lady Greyhounds (15-13) led 5-3 through four innings, but the Lady Eagles knotted it at 5-all in the top of the sixth. Pope took a 1-run lead in the bottom half of the frame only to see Etowah tie it at 6-all through 6½ innings.Kyra Williamson led off the home half of the seventh with a single. The ball got deep into left field on a hit-and-run attempt during Lea McFadden’s at-bat, scoring courtesy runner Jodi Smith with the game-winner.McFadden finished 2-for-4 with an RBI, while Williamson was 2-for-4. Hannah Rogers went 2-for-3 with two RBIs for Pope, which had 12 hits and five errors. Leah Higginbotham had a two-run home run in the first.Trinity Pizzuti (5-1) allowed one unearned run through 1 1/3 innings to get the win.Pope will face Cherokee today in another losers’ bracket game.► South Cobb 8, Westlake 5: Kierra Dudley went 3-for-3 with a double, triple, home run and drove in two to help lead the Lady Eagles to a win in the Region 3 tournament.South Cobb (19-9) will play Newnan today. A win in would allow the Lady Eagles to play for the region championship, while a loss would leave them as the No. 3 seed.Trailing 3-2 going to the bottom of the fourth, Terilyn Harris hit a bases-clearing double to give South Cobb its first lead of the game. Harris finished the night 2-for-4 with a home run and drove in four.Emily Cargle went 3-for-3 with an RBI, while also serving as the winning pitcher.► Fellowship Christian 10, North Cobb Christian 1 (6 inn.): Briley Lawson was 2-for-3 with an RBI, but the Lady Eagles fellow short on senior day.Moriah Hidden, who scored North Cobb Christian’s only run, was honored alongside fellow seniors Lisa Barfield and Emani Hill.The Lady Eagles (5-12, 5-12 Region 6A) will host Mount Zion-Carroll today.
